page.title: 14FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (9).
page.content: {One of our farming families. } Sarah, in the Infant class, lives on one of the farms in our survey area. The family have farmed there for over 100 years. They live in an 80 year old house and farm 92 acres, all of it in grass. They grow no crops but make silage and harvest 2000 bales of hay. They have 40 cows and 3 calves. The cows give 500 litres of milk every day. They keep 49 sheep and 45 lambs. Lambing is December to March.They get 150 kilos.of wool every year.They keep 65 Friesian bullocks. The breed of sheep is Suffolk Cross. They have 6 chickens.They have 4 tractors, a trailer, a grass cutter, a forager and trailer, a hay-bob, a harrow, a fore-end loader, a roller and a baler. They use a silage pit and the big bale method.They also have a milking parlour.
